Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Beem10
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and had an enjoyable stay. It was very easy to get to from the airport, you take the bus and get off at Plaza Universitat and it's a 2 minute walk away. There is a metro station at Plaza Universitat too and you're also only a 5-10 minute walk from Plaza Catalunya and the top of La Rambla which for us was an ideal location to explore the city from. We were pleasantly surprised, having booked an economy room, that when we opened the door to our room it wasn't a box and actually seemed very spacious. However, I am not sure it was actually an economy room since the hotel website went to such great lengths to explain how much smaller the rooms were...We didn't have a view but weren't really bothered, it's a city afterall. The room had two large single beds, wardrobe, desk, chair and tv and a large bathroom with sink, bath/shower, bidet and toilet. It was all very clean and comfortable and you couldn't fault it. The only annoying thing was the hairdryer where you have to continually hold the button down to make it work but these seem common in hotels in Europe anyway! We paid slightly extra when we booked to have breakfast as we didn't want to waste part of the morning looking for somewhere to eat. Breakfast had a good variety of cold meat and cheese, pastries and cakes, yogurts and bacon and scrambled eggs as well as tea and coffee and was always being restocked. We found all the staff in the hotel to be polite and helpful, particularly those at reception, and had an enjoyable stay. This hotel isn't a luxury stay but for a comfortable, clean base in the heart of Barcelona you can't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “I feel like the hotel rob me”
Reviews.Author: Avi S
Reviews.Content: This is a 3 star hotel. We stayed 4 nights and paid 300Euro !!! per night (yes 1200Euro) breakfast not included and the hotel was not ashamed to ask for the safe key 3Euro more !!! The room is without ventilation and opening the window will bring the kitchen smells from the smokestack to your room. The photos on the website are giving the impression of big hotel but the front desk, entrance and room are very small. Actually I blame myself and Booking.com about that. I feel like someone robs me. The booking information at Booking.com is very selective and doesn't give you the full picture about the full price and services. This partial information maybe is a good marketing strategy by booking but not a good service to the guest. - the only point that I can give to this hotel is the good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: HappyCampers2617
Reviews.Content: Ok so just like you, I went through a bucket load of reviews of different hotels trying to find the best one for our trip to Barcelona! This really is the best and most useful true way to do it. This hotel gives you an excellent location right in the heart of Barcelona. 5 mins from Catalunya Square which leads to all the shops and traditional market and also bus tour routes throughout the city. Our stay at the hotel was definitely one to remember for all the right reasons. The room was smart and stylish with modern facilities including a magificent bathroom and great view of the street and bars across from it. If you are considering a short stay in the city then this is the place to be! Quiet location considering it's central spot, prime location to all tourist facilities and very good value! I'd like to add that it is definitely worth getting transfers as it's a weight of your mind and our driver was very knowledgable and willing to suggest places to eat and drink as were the staff at the front desk of the hotel who were very polite and knowledgable also! Should be 4* at least!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: NIrelandGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying at this hotel 1 night pre-cruise and 1 after the cruise I must say this is an excellent hotel spotlessly clean and very friendly I discovered this hotel on my last visit to Barcelona and it was just as good on the second visit I have stayed in hotels in this city before and had a glass of champagne given to me when I was signing in but I paid double the price for the room which I was seldom in Now this is not a 4 star hotel and the room rate per night reflects that It is a very comfortable affordable hotel with very friendly staff in a great location

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not great either.”
Reviews.Author: Sean C
Reviews.Content: There are a number of pros and cons associated with this hotel. I'll be as fair and as accurate as I can possibly be. THE POSITIVES: the hotel has a great central location. It's within walking distance to Las Ramblas, the Gothic Quarter and the Marina. There is an underground train station just around the corner for getting everywhere else in the city. The hotel itself is well presented, clean and tidy. Room service happened every morning while we were there. The breakfast (extra charge) is pretty good too. THE NEGATIVES: The walls of the rooms are like paper! You can hear a lot of what is going on in the room next to you. If you get a room to the front of the building be aware that it can be quite noisy a lot of the time, which may affect your sleep as was the case of a couple who were with us. Above the hotel is private apartments and while we were there the apartments were having work done. The work started at the crack of dawn and had us up from 8am! Some of the staff are not very friendly, although others were more than happy to help us if we had any requests. When we were checking out we had a rude woman who accused us of using the phone and the mini-bar. None of us did either of those things. Overall - for the price the hotel is pretty decent but don't be expecting anything other than basic!

Reviews.Title: “Small and cosy hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: platonalex
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in Pl. Universitat. 5 min walk to Rambla St and Pl. Catalunya. The staff is really helpful. Free wifi in all the hotel. If you are on a roadtrip by car they have a deal with a nearby parking and you pay only half price ( 10 euro/per day, other parking places charge you 24 euro's ). The breakfast is really good and diversified. You can find a lot of good eating places around.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: VedranSailor
Reviews.Content: I was staying in this hotel in the middle of November for 4 days, and two years ago for one week. It has great location just around the corner of Plaza Universitat, where Aerobus from the airport stops, so it's easy to access. Metro station is also here, and to Plaza Catalunya is 10 min walk. This small hotel is nicely furnished, rooms are good-sized and bathrooms also. Bed was comfortable, but I did not like blankets and linens. Inside room view is not nice, but in Barcelona you don't stay a lot in a room. The other thing which I noticed is that room door does not provide good protection from noise in the corridor. It doesn't have a bar or a la carte restaurant, only the breakfast hall, but breakfast is mostly not included in the price. It is better to buy it in hotel than at booking because it's cheaper. Price was great, more than vorth a value. To recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: karol85
Reviews.Content: Location wise its within walking distance to all touristy destinations shops and restaurants. Staff very helpful, Breakfast was just right offering everything you need to start the day. Be carefull when coming back to the hotel early morning as there are a lot of thug looking people hanging around the hotel vacinity. Rooms were spacious enough to stay at for the 4 night we were there with a decent size bathroom. Rooms serviced every day to great standards. Overall a great experience. Trip to Monsserrat highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Alex M
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here. I was with my kids. I liked the location. From the airport - take the bus to the city and get out at the universtat stop. A 3 min walk and your in front of the hotel. Rooms were clean and efficient. Hotel staff were friendly. Easy walk to la rambla. Supermarket and groceries close by. Metro also right around the corner. Only hassle was the hotel entrance was always locked and needed someone from inside to open. Not a big deal but be careful not to bump against the glass door thinking it will open. Certainly thin walls - so try to keep it down especially with little kids. TV - everything was spanish cartoons but still kids were fine after some moans. Wifi is available. Coffee in the corridors for a euro. Breakfast was available but we didnt have any from the hotel. Good value. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Terry U
Reviews.Content: If you're in a neversleeping Mediterranean city for a limited time, location gets more and more important. I believe, you have to stay in a hotel which enables you reach everywhere on foot. Even if drunk late at night! Acta Splendid was a perfect choice, in this sense. Nothing special indeed, it was a standard downtown hotel with clean and spacious rooms overlooking Plaza Goya. It helped us alot to have a very nice extended weekend and enjoy the vibrant streets of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great and clean facility, central location, good value”
Reviews.Author: lab51
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived in Barcelona very late at night, 11'ish, but nobody was answering the door at the nearby B&B where we had our reservation. Fortunately, Splendid Hotel has an opening. We were impressed with the very clean facilities, the security, the first-rate amenities, the WiFi availability (some hotels advertised but do not have workable internet access), the friendly staff. We decided to stay another night. Special mention for the sparkling clean and large bathroom. The hotel is centrally located and very near the metro, the Ramblas, and most attractions. We did not select the breakfast option, but there are many wonderful tapa bars, restaurants and supermarket nearby. We like the Catedra bar nearby with the friendly waiters and the good and reasonably-priced menu selections. Splendid allowed us to store our luggages and that worked well for us. Will be happy to return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location, clean rooms but thin walls...”
Reviews.Author: Davesama
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the first week of September and overall had a positive experience. The rooms, though small, are kept clean and tidy by an attentive housekeeping staff. Every day we came back there was always fresh bed sheets and towels. The bed was firm but comfortable and the general finish was very nice. The bathrooms are very nice with excellent powerful showers and a very nice range of toiletries which includes a sealed and new razor and shaving gel, 2 sealed and new toothbrushes with toothpaste as well as the usual soap. shoe polish, vanity kits etc. I've stayed in 5 star hotels that didn't have as nice a selection as this. The hotel is in a good location near the heart of the city, literally around the corner from a metro station and about 10 minutes walk from Catalunya square and Las Ramblas. There are a few bars and a club nearby but we didn't have much trouble with noise with the windows closed. We did have an issue with the air con on the first night not working properly so the room was really uncomfortably warm, but we were so tired from our long day that we opted to sleep through it and complain the next day. The air con then fixed itself before we got a chance to bring it up. Once it was working we were a bit scared to turn it off again so we let it run and it actually got pretty chilly after a while! I cant deny it was wonderful to come back to after a day out in the hot sun. The only other problem we had was that the walls are thin and the plumbing noisy. Every time anyone went in or out of their room or used their shower on our floor we knew about it. This was mostly a problem in the mornings as the girlfriend and I preferred to sleep in. On balance a pretty good hotel considering the location and the cost. I'd probably come here again if I was looking to stay in central Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: tbluesky1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Acta Splendid for 3 nights. On arrival our room wasn't ready (understandably, since we arrived well before the check-in time) but we could leave our luggages there free of charge. Same happened when checking out as we didn't leave for the airport until late afternoon. Staff were really friendly and helpful except for one member of staff who worked one evening, he wasn't particularly helpful somehow other than that excellent customer service. Our room was on the third floor, spacious and light. There was plenty of toiletries in the bathroom and big soft towels. We noticed first night that the sink was blocked so water didn't go down but as soon as we reported it on the reception the following morning, the problem was rectified. We didn't take breakfast in the hotel, however breakfast room looked lovely, too. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a not too pricey hotel in a prime location of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GregTa555
Reviews.Content: We spent five days at the Splendid in April 2011. The staff was helpful and friendly. The room was large enough with a nice closet and great bathroom. Very clean and quiet. Besides the above the location is great. Two blocks away from the very easy to use Metro. Walking distance to the Market, Oldtown, Gothic Area, LaRambla, University, and the Sea if you are fit. We plan on going back to this great city sometime and when we do we will stay at the Splendid.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and hospitable staff”
Reviews.Author: faband41
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my two teenagers to Spain and we spent 3 nights in Barcelona at this hotel. I wanted a clean, moderate priced hotel that had air conditioning and this one fit the bill. The staff was very accomodating as we arrived without our luggage from our flight. They made phone calls to Portugal to check the status and also tried to assist in getting the Renfe train tickets online for us to Madrid. The location was excellent, within walking distance to The Ramblas and not far from a Starbucks! I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Good but inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: kar8pet
Reviews.Content: Service is very professional, hotel facilities good. Our room was rather small for the furniture in it (two armchairs and table as well as a bench and double bed), average quality furnishings. In contrast the bathroom excellent, modern and well equipped. Everything clean and well organised. Rooms facing the courtyard have small windows and hence are dark, front ones have large windows but presumably can be noisy. The main problem was airconditioning: there was no thermostat so the choice was to freeze or be hot - can't understand why someone would install efficient airconditioning and not a thermostat. Location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend hotell, great location, clean room”
Reviews.Author: Staffan72
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. We stayed 3 nights on a weekend trip and the service was really good with no remarks. Check in was quick and easy. Reception staff was friendly and informative. Room was basic but clean. TV, fridge, Aircon, clean bathroom. Beds were pretty hard, even if it doesn't bother me. Location was really good, in an area that felt calm and away from the busiest tourist district. It was a 5 min walk from the Airport bus arrival, and 15 min walk to get to the bus when returning to the airport. Same 15 minutes to get to La Rambla. Either on the main road or a quicker shortcut through smaller streets in Raval. We never felt unsafe walking home during night. Sure, lots of kids hanging around, but what´s the problem with kids on skateboards or chilling outside bars..? There were some local food places close to the hotel and we had both ok breakfast and spontaneous tapas on the way home at night on one of them. Breakfast at the hotel was 10 euro per person, but we never checked it out. Free internet access was available on a pc on 1st floor and we could email our boarding passes to the reception and they would print them for free. Nice feature. Unfortunately I never got the unlocked wifi working on my smartphone. Bad coverage it seemed. + Location: calm area on a nice and short distance from La Rambla - Nothing obvious. Perhaps that they seemed to have free wifi but I never got it working.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: shamgaro
Reviews.Content: small but clean, near ststion universitat, just near the old sity. 1 moment walking from the metro and from the bus station from the airport. internet and aircondition in rooms. we didn't try the breakfast and prefer the many coffee bars and patissery nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: d-fo-nyc
Reviews.Content: Nice room, comfy beds, extra pillows, nice size bath. Staff was friendly and helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “gr8 stay away from busy city centre! don't bother with breakfast though.”
Reviews.Author: quiffLondon
Reviews.Content: me and my husband stayed here and had a good stay as it was away from the noisy traffic and hustle and bustle of tourists. yes it is a good 10 minute walk into the centre but its worth it. rooms are ok and have all you need for a short stay.however if i had been staying longer i would have asked them to fix the wardrobe door as it would not open properly.the breakfasts, if there was anythjing left,you'd have to ask for more to be put out,otherwise youd be eating only yoghurts and fruit. are not worth the extra money i would suggest room only basis. These are silly niggly things and would highly reccommend this hotel as a place to stay. staff were always courtious and helpfull.Remember also that the aerobus' 9 euros return' is fab 4 dropping you off near the hotel'placa universitat' but on the return leg you will have to walk with luggage to the next stop'placa catalunya' inorder to catch the bus back to the airport.One last thing we found a gr8 restaurant in' placa reial' off of las ramblas called Rossini's. I reccommend them highly as we ate there twice after being very dissappointed in others. their pizza and pasta was just as good as in italy!Also i suggest you buy a 2 day bus tour 'hop on and off' they explain everything with an audio guide or go it alone on their very easy metro system just like the london under ground, you can buy single trip or daily travel cards or multiple days, good value compared to london!

Reviews.Title: “better than i expected”
Reviews.Author: bunnybenni
Reviews.Content: the hotel located at convenience area and i dont have any problem to access to any tourist spots... Room is small but clean... One thing was i didnt manage to get a room with balcony...

Reviews.Title: “GREAT 4 DAY CITY BREAK”
Reviews.Author: allan90
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Barcelona , had a great holiday for 4 days. We stayed in the Acta Splendid hotel, in room 307. The room, bathroom and shower were very good. Great spreads for breakfasts. Reception staff very friendly. The hotel is in a very good position to get into the city. 10mins walk into the La Rambla. We visited the food Market off the La Rambla,Mercat de la Boqueria and had two meals at one of the Tapas bars, Great food cooked right in front of you and at a great price,but you have to fight for a seat as it's very popular! We visted The Gothic Cathedral,Park Ciutadella, The Beach , The old Town, Park Guell, Sagrada Familia, La Pedrera and Font Magica. You must not miss Sagrada familia or Laprera . For transport use the Metro, the 10 rides for 8euros, and you can both use the same ticket. The only problem with Barcelona is the pickpockets , DO NOT TAKE YOUR WALLET AND CARDS out with you. Use the hotel safe , only take out money for the trip that you are on. A favourite trick for the pickpockets ( two or three in a gang) is to swoop behind you as you get onto the metro and pick your pocket, they tried it with me but I just pushed his hand away , so be careful and put your money in different places and split it up between you.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, good location,”
Reviews.Author: clarabellagray
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Acta Splendid after an unpleasant experience at the Bed and Breakfast Muntaner next door. The hotel is clean, modern and typical of moderately priced city accommodation. It's also in an excellent location - very close to the Universitat Metro station and about 5-10 minutes walk from La Rambla. I can't really criticise the decor of the hotel at all; the room was very nice with modern furnishings, TV, mini bar/fridge, tiled bathroom, good shower, towels etc. Very comfortable and pleasant by my standards and I can often be fussy. However, the customer service is very typical of what you find throughout Barcelona - not very friendly or welcoming. We were also put on a smoking floor without being asked, which didn't bother me, but I know it would others! The breakfast was good - cereal, bread, fresh fruit, cooked and cold meats, pastries etc - but not included in the cost of the room, but €8 per day (plus tax) payable on departure is fairly reasonable. All in all, the hotel is a good choice for a trip to Barcelona - modern and comfortable rooms, reasonably priced, in a central location - just don't expect the reception staff to give you service with a smile! That's just Barcelona, if you accept it you will have a good time. I would recommend Hotel Acta Splendid to friends and others.

Reviews.Title: “A life saver - a great, clean and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: pugslyNCL
Reviews.Content: We found this place by accident after being badly let down by the Gat Raval Hostel. The staff were very friendly and the rooms were medium sized but very clean and with a decent bathroom. It was an absolute life saver! It was a room overlooking the street but was quiet and comfortable. I think they gave us a slight discount as they still had empty rooms late in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Very rude service”
Reviews.Author: GeshaZ
Reviews.Content: You can't bring visitors in this hotel. Me and my fiancee were staying at the hotel for 4 nights. Last night we meet a friends of ours, and they went with us to the hotel. We shared pictures and experiences, and after about 3 hours they left. The very next morning I was surprised to discover that I have to pay for their visit - 130 Euro ! (65 Euro per visitor). I was trying to explain that they went to our place without any luggage and never stayed to sleep, that nobody explained to me about this rule and that I never signed a document noting about the issue. Nothing helped - I was charged. In addition, the concierge was very rude and didn't opened a door till I payed. I think that's a violation of basic rules and I do not recommend this hotel. PS. The walls are very thin, you can hear everything around.

Reviews.Title: “Bright and airy, but hardly salubrious”
Reviews.Author: LeVisitant
Reviews.Content: Mid range European city fayre: Smallish hotel with cramped quarters but this is offset by bright public spaces and an attempt at art nouveau that just about convinces. Breakfast is passable but the dining space can become crowded if the hotel is full. Main sights walkable, not exactly 'on your doorstep' but this is a super city for strolling so this is hardly an inconvenience. Prices are on a par with similar properties in a city with very high rates of occupance year round. One or two nice cafes/bars in the vicinity as well. I'd recommend for a 2-3 day city break, anything longer and perhaps more creature comforts will be found elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for a budget hotel in...”
Reviews.Author: tomasvdb
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a budget hotel in the heart of barcelona, this is it. Good location, well priced and clean rooms. I can't imagine better value for money, especially since we only paid 65 euro a night for a double room

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but don't let them call you a cab”
Reviews.Author: darkirony
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated, but the walls are thin and if you are hoping to sleep early (like for an early train) then you will have trouble with that. Breakfast was good, the ingredients fresh that day. The other warning I have is when you need a cab, just step into the street for one. There are always lots about, even very early on a Sunday. Otherwise, you will have to pay the cabby the fee he had to pay the hotel guy as a kickback for calling you the cab in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: marsrio62
Reviews.Content: Very good location, just one block from Placa Universitad, where there is an Airport Bus stop when arriving. The hotel is placed a few blocks off Placa Catalunya, in a safe neighborhood. My room was a bit small, but quiet and clean. The rate did not include breakfast, but there are cafeterias nearby, including Starbucks. A free internet station is available on the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless with a great location to boot!”
Reviews.Author: got2bfunky
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now and really have never found a fault with this hotel. Location is excellent, 2mins from Universitat Metro and airport bus. Less than 10 min walk to Place De La Catalunya. Price wise it is one of the cheapest in BCN but it really does punch above its weight. We used it purely as a place to sleep and change, as it doesnt have a bar and the reception is basic, and on that basis 10 out of 10!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Cygnet
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the Apsis Splendid in September 2008, visiting Barcelona for a friend's 50th birthday celebration. Others had recommended it to me for its convenient location and reasonable cost. They were right. Only a short walk from Placa de Catalunya, and the Universitat metro station was even closer. While the front desk staff were not exactly chatty, they got the job done of checking one in and out... and staff looking after the buffet breakfast were pleasant. My room was very clean and a good size, and overlooked the little square behind the hotel. I am told there was a nightclub in the street on that side of the hotel, but I didn't hear it!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: rajul
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights and found the room perfectly adequate for one traveler, with an excellent bathroom and closet. The morning/afternoon staff were extremely helpful and pleasant, the night staff less so. The breakfast buffet is great for budget travelers. Of course the main attraction is paying 60 euros a night for a prime location, near the Gran Via, Las Ramblas and the gothic district.

Reviews.Title: “city trip”
Reviews.Author: AntoA
Reviews.Content: pretty and clean, but a bit noisy due to his location, only 5 min. away from Plaça Catalunya. Staff is friendly. large Buffet at breakfast

Reviews.Title: “My 3rd visit”
Reviews.Author: destinyschild
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel and the staff. It's near enough to the centre (5mins walk from Placa de Catalunya) but a bit quieter, has parking at a garage around the corner(24 Euro per day, but it's a city,London costs a lot more)and the rooms are great.Had a suite this time as a family room which was so comfortable and had a large en suite. Booked on the hotels own site without breakfast, special offer at the hotel for breakfast 8Euro instead of 14 so had that 1 day. Will stay there again, and love the 7 Sins lounge bar accross the street.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, great value, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: itchyfeetx2
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique hotel on a quiet street about a block from the Plaza de Universidad. Rooms were comfortable and nicely appointed, although small by American standards. As former innkeepers, we are very fussy about cleanliness. We looked in all the corners and even ran a finger over top of picture frames --- we didn't find a speck of dirt or dust! The service is very helpful and friendly. Alex was especially helpful! The rates are very affordable; the hotel was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it!”
Reviews.Author: leoslass
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with my husband and teenage son before a Med cruise. We arrived at Barcelona airport around 8 pm and as it was dark and we had 4 bags decided to take a taxi to the hotel for 25 Euros. The reception is small, we found the staff pleasant but they did not talk much. Our triple room on the top floor was quite compact and nicely fitted out with wood flooring, quality bed linen and an excellent bathroom. The hotel was spotlessly clean throughout. We found the room too cold with the air conditioning on, but just right with it turned off. Our room looked on to the light shaft but the bonus was it was exceptionally quiet. Breakfast was good and included in the price we paid. We found the area around the hotel OK and not at all seedy. It was just a little out of the main tourist area but we were aware of this when we booked. We went on the underground at Universitat to go to the Magic Fountains at Montjuic in the evening and found it easy and safe. We enjoyed our stay and would stay at this or another Apsis hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Once was enough”
Reviews.Author: hawaiiansun1
Reviews.Content: A shockingly rude manager that spoiled anything positive about the hotel. I was checking out of the hotel and was witness to the rudest manager and her confrontation with other guests that appeared to be overcharged on their bill. The women were trying to be reasonable and the manager was the coldest, rudest hotel manager that I have ever encountered in all my hotel stays around the world. Find a different hotel would be my recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean and Central”
Reviews.Author: Helking
Reviews.Content: A group of 8 of us stayed in 4 rooms at the Splendid. The rooms we had were all quiet despite a couple of them facing the front of the hotel. Our room was facing a central light well and was exceptionally quiet. All of the rooms we had ranged from reasonably sized to quite large and all were very modern and clean. The bathrooms are lovely all marble and a good size with an excellent range of toiletries and amenities for a hotel of this rating. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as there are plenty of more reasonably priced options within walking distance including a very nice cafe across the road. The hotel is in an excellent location literally a few minutes walk from Univerity Square, where there is a metro stop. Placa de la catalunya, La Rambla, Passieg De Gracia and much more are all within easy walking distance, even Port Vell and Barceloneta can be easily reached on foot for those who like to walk a little. The only thing that I felt the hotel lacked was a lounge area although this was not a major problem it would have been nice to have somewhere we could all sit and wait to meet up. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and I would definitely recommend this hotel as it is an excellent option for the price. A couple of tips, book directly with the hotel online to get the best price. The Aerobus from the airport stops at University Sqaure a few minutes walk and is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel not so Splendid after-all!”
Reviews.Author: whatakik
Reviews.Content: I would never again stay at the Hotel Apsis Splendid or any of their other hotels. The hotel manager was unreasonable and unkind. We were charged for an extra room because of a confusing error on their website. We were never even offered the key to the room that we were charged for! We didn't even realized we were paying for the room or that the room was even booked under our name, until the next day when the deskman told us. He said this happens frequently and not to worry about it. However the following day the manager insisted we pay for the room and threatened to call the police if we didn't pay. Since we already dealt with the "police" when our carry-on luggage was stolen upon arrival...we knew it was a hopeless case. I called their main office, and was told someone would get right back to me...I am still waiting...haha! With all the crime, on the streets and otherwise, maybe when there aren't so many tourists going to Barcelona, they will get the message?

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Colin330
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I'd arranged to meet up with friends in Barcelona and they suggested it for budgetary reasons. As such it was adequate: a very spacious room (internal, so no street noise), decent quality bathroom and spotless. I just hated the bed - it was rock hard and not to my taste at all. The air con is not really adjustable - its either on and very cold, or off. You choose! Breakfast is optional and the hotel provides a reasonable and very plentiful choice for this standard of hotel. Unusually, unlimited free access to the internet is available. Useful for checking onward connections etc. A request for 24 hr turnaround on some laundry was completed the same day and to a high standard. All the various receptionists (there were quite a few rostered over a 3 day period) were all very helpful and courteous. The location is also convenient for many of the city's attractions, especially the city rover tourist bus stop. Not a flash place but if all you intend to do is use it to sleep and as your base for sightseeing etc, you won't go far wrong. But it will suit those best who like their bed to be hard!

Reviews.Title: “Thieives and Crooks”
Reviews.Author: inthegarden5
Reviews.Content: They booked us for two rooms instead of one and initially told us they'd take care of it. The next day, they informed us that we would be charged for the extra room and threatened to call the police if we didn't sign the voucher and pay for it. We argued that we weren't even offered a key to this 'second' room and were never able to utilize it, but now we're being charged for it. The reservation that I printed off my computer looked so ambiguous that nobody could tell I was being charged for two rooms instead of one. I'm just curious how many visitors they pull this on. They will have to deal with my credit card company now. There are too many nice places to stay in Barcelona, I would stay clear of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as I expected”
Reviews.Author: Calartist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Apsis Splendid hotel for 2 nights in June 2008 following our Mediterranean cruise from the port of Barcelona. (It was a dream vacation!) We were also supposed to stay 1 night prior to the cruise, but our American Airlines flight was canceled and we arrived to Barcelona only hours before we were to embark the Brilliance of the Seas. Needless to say, the hotel charged us for the night even though we were a no show due to circumstances beyond our control. But that does not impact my review of this hotel. I booked with the Apsis Splendid based on the very positive reviews on Trip Advisor. I knew this hotel was not a 5 star property and that the rooms were rather small, so I had my expectations set appropriately. Overall, I was still a bit disappointed. First, the street this hotel is located on is a bit on the "seedy" side. It literally smelled of urine right outside the hotel. The pictures on the hotel website don't truly reflect what the hotel looks like from the outside. They must have been taken right after the shrubs were planted and the outside walls and sidewalk thoroughly cleaned with a high pressure hose and a lot of detergent. The lobby is extremely tiny--about the size of a small bedroom. There is room only for two tiny chairs from Ikea, and a tiny table for a floral arrangement, then the front desk. The personnel were overall polite and professional. The guest rooms are as tiny as our cruise stateroom. Literally, there was only room for the bed and a few suitcases. Since this is my first time in Europe, maybe my point of reference is not good. But believe me, the rooms are very, very small. The best part of the hotel is that the bathrooms are unexpectedly nice. They are tiled in marble and are very modern and clean. That is the saving grace of the Apsis Splendid: great bathrooms! We did not pay for the buffet and ate our breakfast at the local farmer's market on La Rambla. We had a 2 egg breakfast with potatoes, sausage, toast, orange juice, and coffee for 7 Euro. I imagined the hotel as being steps from La Rambla, but it is a walk to get there. It does take about 10 minutes to get to the main street. There is a bar directly across from the hotel, but it never was a problem for us. Although our window faced the street, it was quiet and we had no problem falling asleep. This hotel is very interesting in that you must insert your room key into a slot in the wall to get the electricity to work in your room. Consequently, when you leave the room, every electrical device turns off (including the air conditioning.) Only the TV and refrigerator remain operational without the key in the wall. Also, getting ice for your room is a bit of a mystery. There are no ice machines for guests, so you have to either call down stairs or go there your self. They have you wait as the scurry off somewhere and then a few minutes later, they reappear with the tiniest amount of ice. Once, the maid literally gave me a small glass with 3 ice cubes and asked if that was enough. So, they are very stingy with their ice. Another problem is the mattress. They feel very low quality and are very hard. I am used to the Hilton or Marriott mattresses in the US that make you feel like you are floating in a cloud. These mattresses are like sleeping on a piece of plywood with a little bit of padding. Regarding pick pockets in Barcelona--please be very careful with your wallet and baggage! We were warned of this, so all our money was carried in a money belt. We did not carry wallets in our pockets. One poor guest arrived at the hotel in tears, telling the front desk that she had placed her luggage down for a second to look at a map, and two guys grabbed her bags and ran off with them. She was understandably shaken. Be very careful and you should have no problems. They have all kinds of con artists--especially ones that work with accomplices that form a diversion to distract you--such as street performers or people asking for directions. So, overall, I was a little disappointed. I wanted to like this hotel and thought it would be a secret gem at a bargain price. Who knows, maybe compared with other hotels in Barcelona at this price range, it is a gem. But I think travelers should be aware of the drawbacks. I would give this place only 2 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: KazandEz
Reviews.Content: 22-27 June 2008 Just returned from a very enjoyable trip to Barcelona staying at the Apsis Splendid Hotel. We were in Room No 308 - very spacious, internal bathroom and view out back to rear of buildings (and on a good day, man practicing his yoga on his balcony!) We arrived fairly late in the evening and were offered the choice of 2 rooms - a tiny double room (103) or twin in 308. Looking out to the rear of the hotel meant we were never disturbed by any street noise. We took the airport bus to the hotel which was very easy and only 4.05 euro single. The hotel is perfectly situated for all the sites, and about a 10 minute walk to top of the Ramblas. It is a nice size with excellent breakfasts including cereals, cold meats/cheeses, cooked (including best chorizo ever) and breads/rolls etc. Staff are friendly and very happy to give you advice and ideas of places to visit. Having read all the stories about pick-pocketers in Barca, we took every precaution possible and had no trouble! Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Nice Price”
Reviews.Author: MadCityJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It is centrally located in the southwestern section of the Eixample, close to most of the major sites (5-20 minute walk to most). The staff was extremely helpful and friendly and the room was clean with a great bathroom. The breakfast buffet offered is delicious - lots of different juices, coffee, milk, eggs, spanish meats and cheeses, fresh fruit , breads and pastries (Word of warning: we received a deal on the breakfast - only 7 euros - but the normal price is 14 euros. The breakfast is very good but NOT worth 14 euros. The only downside is that our room was on the Calle Muntaner side of the building and with a bar right outside the window, it can get quite noisy at night. If you are a light-sleeper ask for a room in the interior of the hotel. Overall, highly recommended for location, price and quality of room. If we are ever in Barcelona again, we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel,best value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Spanishfly711
Reviews.Content: A short 7 minute walk to Las Ramblas. About 25 euros from the airport. Spacious,clean bathroom,helpful front desk staff and a good variety for a buffet breakfast. Free access to a internet pc in the lobby.I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A”
Reviews.Author: arsenalrocks
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Apsis Splendid Hotel!! It was close to Ramblas and other attractions. The staff was very helpful and pleasant, especially David. He gave us dining recommendations and insights into Barcelona. There is also a computer on the first floor where you can use the Internet for free! The room was small, but it fit our needs just fine. There was a small tv and a mini bar. Across the street from the hotel is a bar/restaurant called The Seven Sins. We went there twice! They have the BEST hamburgers we have ever eaten. Alex the bartender was super friendly and very cool! The Apsis Splendid is a great bargin and wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elaine118
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short break with friends at the Apsis Splendid. This hotel is perfectly situated, with the Aeroport Bus only a few minutes walk away and the hotel is only about 5 minutes walk away from La Ramblas and Placa Catalunya. The hotel was very pleasant, clean and smart and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a second floor room at the front overlooking the square and cafe opposite which was very spacious and light, the only slight downside was the noise of the traffic in the morning, but that is expected in a city hotel. Buffet breakfast was included in our room rate which was excellent value with plenty of choice, including bacon, sausage, scrambled egg and spanish omelette, cereals, fruits, meats and cheeses, bread rolls, toast and choice of juices. All in all we felt the quality, price and value was very good for a City Hotel. If you are exploring Barcelona the Bus Turistica is a better otion than the Barcelona Tour Bus which the hotel promoted as it had three routes which you could hop-on and hop-off and tickets are available to purchase directly on the bus or at the Placa Catalunya. Barcelona is a wonderful city to explore with plenty to see and do. Dont eat on La Ramblas, we found two excellent restaurants, Les Quinze Nits in the Placa Reial and La Fonda - both excellent value. Be warned though you do have to queue!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet for city centre”
Reviews.Author: Richardsreviews
Reviews.Content: Just off Plaza Universitat and convenient for Plaza Catalunya and The Ramblas. 5mins walk from the airport bus stop at Pl Universitat. Clean and quiet, the only noise being other guests leaving early in the morning. Good fresh breakfast, only let down by a limited selection of hot dishes. Had scrambled eggs, Spanish omlette, sausages and bacon, but no tomatoes, mushrooms or beans. Do not know about the air conditioning as we stayed there in Feb, but the hotel was warm then.Cellar de Tapas on Pl Universitat was useful for evening meals, with a varied selection of vegetarian tapas.

Reviews.Title: “Location was excellent”
Reviews.Author: offalyhero
Reviews.Content: The hotel was decent. Small lobby, medium sized room, stylish bathroom but shower head was a bit dodgy. The location was perfect, couldnt have asked for better in that regard. If I was in Barcelona again I would stay here simply because the location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place good for short stay”
Reviews.Author: fradon
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel, went with my gilfiend, stayed for 5 days. Great place to enjoy the sites of Barca. This hotel is right beside the Universitat Metro Stop so thats great. The time we were there there was a new building being built beside us, drills started at 7 in the morning!!! Good Location, close to everything with the metro!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aqueous27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and booked direct through the hotel website. On arriving at the airport it was quite easy to get a bus direct to Universitat (Aerobus 3.90 euros) where the hotel is only a five minute walk away. We were given room 218 (don't stay in this room) the room was large and the bathroom lovely but for £75.00 per night (not including breakfast - so basically just somewhere to sleep) there was no view unless you enjoy looking into a small courtyard or other people's rooms and the air conditioning did not work, and trust me opening the window meant all you could hear was the lift going up and down and the kitchen in the morning. The staff were helpful when it came to selling us a bus tour (barcelona bus is cheaper and you can hop on-hop off, however the busses are less frequent than bus turistic busses and they have 3 different routes you can hop on and hop off) but the staff were less enthused to help us with comfort within our room and we also heard our neighbour complaining about the heat too! The hotel is in a great location, close to catalunya and las ramblas and the metro station too. Definately worth a visit - La Sagradia Familia, Guell Park, Gaudi works in general, all beautiful and the gardens and parks at Mount Juic catch the funicular cable car and admire the view. Watch out for restaurants on las ramblas, we got ripped off at a tapas place who charged 10 euros for a coke and a fanta! there is a lovely restaurant going from the university to placa catalunya on the right hand side down a side street (can't remember the name) lovely paella! overall had a fantastic time in the city, the hotel however in my opinion has some naff rooms which do not accompany the hotels 3* rating!

Reviews.Title: “Would go back to Apsis Splendid again”
Reviews.Author: Caprioska
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Very convenient location. Walking distance to markets and Unibersitat Train station ROOMS: Rooms are very clean, new and modern. I especially liked the modern bathrooms. SERVICE: The staff were helpful and professional FOOD: Plenty of choices for the buffet breakfast Overall, I would go back to this hotel again. It's a small boutique hotel that has good facilities and the fact that it's small adds to its charm.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sterussell
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at the Apsis Splendid. Everything positive that has been said previously about this hotel is correct. It is a geat price for a good hotel with a perfect location. The hotel is a few minutes walk from the Ramblas in a nice quiet street. It is perfect to get the Aerobus to as only 2 minutes from the stop at Universitat. The hotel staff are excellent and very helpful. The breakfast was included in the price and very good too. Very safe location and the rooms are what you would expect from this very good 3 star hotel. If it had a few more frills it could pass as a 4 star easily. Nonetheless, an excellent city hotel. We travel extensively, and this hotel does what it says on the tin. Free internet access a winner too. Don't hesitate, book it today.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kitzexpat
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at the Apsis Splendid. We found the location to be very convenient, just steps from the Placa Univesitat stop of the Airport bus, close to the Metro and within a short walk from the Ramblas. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was spacious, clean and modern and had a safe which we rented for Euro 3 per day and a conveniently priced minibar. We did not book the breakfast but had our breakfasts at the bar across the street, which provided for a nice and inexpensive local experience. Overall a very positive experience. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: georgegorilla
Reviews.Content: Good points: * Breakfasts were included in our deal (booked on Opodo) and they were excellent: a choice of cereals, breads, muffins and pastries, fruit, cold meats and cheeses, bacon and eggs, all set out on a help yourself buffet. * All staff were really friendly and helpful. * There’s a computer with free internet access on the first floor. * Handy location near to the Plaça Universitat (and the airport bus stop! Also a metro station, although we didn’t use the underground). It’s just a few minutes’ walk to Plaça Catalunya and Las Ramblas. * The room had a mini bar fridge which you can use for your own drinks and snacks. The not-so-good points: * Room safes are not included in the room rate (I always think it’s a bit cheeky to charge you extra for use of a safe, even if it is only 3€ a day). * We arrived prior to check-in time and were told we could leave our luggage in reception while we went out for lunch. There is always a receptionist on duty, but I didn’t like the fact that our luggage wasn’t stored away in a separate room. On the whole, though, the good points far outweigh the not-so-good points, and I would recommend this as a great base for exploring Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,Great location”
Reviews.Author: db1873
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Apsis Splendid for 5 nights at the start of September. The hotel has a great location very close to the Universitat metro stop. If arriving by bus from BCN the aerobus 1 stops at Placa Universitat and the hotel is a short walk away. Our first room was a double and was quite small but it was clean and nicely decorated. We were wakened at 7:30 on the second morning of our stay by water dripping from the ceiling in the bathroom. This was in no way the fault of the hotel as the above floor is not part of the hotel. We were immediately moved to a twin room on the same floor which was actually a much bigger room so we were happy with the result. The hotel is about 5 mins walk from Placa Catalunya and Las Ramblas but is far enough away so that a good nights sleep should be no problem. There is an open top tourbus literally around the corner and tickets can be puchased at hotel reception. They are €20 for 1 day or €24 for 2 consecutive days. This is a great way to see Barcelona's main attractions and would be recommended if this is your first visit to Barcelona. The best way to get about Barcelona however is by the metro. A single journey will cost €1,25 per person but there are multiple journey tcikets available. The one that we used was the T-10 ticket. This gives the user 10 journeys for a price of €6,90 euros and can be used by more than one person. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel as there are loads of cafes close by. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family and would stay here again if travelling to Barcelona. I would also recommend booking as far in advance as possible as the hotel went up in price three times whilst we tried to decide on a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not Great”
Reviews.Author: debstah
Reviews.Content: For our 5-night stay from August 6-11, we took the Aerobus from the BCN airport to Placa Universitat for 3.90 euros and were just a few steps from this hotel. The metro is also literally right around the corner, as is a wonderful bakery and even a Starbucks if you need. Placa Catalunya is between a 5-10 minute leisurely stroll, or one easy subway stop and the shop and restaurant-filled streets Rambla de Catalunya and Passeig de Gracia are just a few minutes walk or one subway stop as well. Having this hotel as our base was so easy because of the fantastic location right by the metro, which we used several times a day with a 4-day pass. The hotel itself is a little smaller than I expected, but the rooms, although very small, were well-apointed, very clean, and the beds very comfortable. One downside was that there were no English channels whatsoever (sometimes, CNN International came in fuzzy) - this wasn't a big deal for us as we weren't in the room that much, but I mention it for those who might care. We opted to not take the breakfast for 7 euros a night, so I cannot comment on that, and instead found very good bakeries all around the hotel with croissants for just over 1 euro. There were also several convenience stores and supermarkets in the immediate area, which was nice to be able to keep water and other things in the minibar fridge (although it did not keep things very cold, it was better than nothing). I was never able to get the wireless internet to work, although I know it exists. But on the first floor there is a free computer terminal which was fine to check email, research restaurants and public transportation, and the like. There were 3-4 different people at the hotel desk that rotated throughout the day and they were very kind and helpful whenever we had a question. It is one of those hotels where your electronic key turns on the lights in the room and then you give the desk the key when you leave for the day. We never had any problems with this. All in all, for under 100 euros a night for a clean and comfortable room in such a perfect location, I think it is hard to beat. It has the amenities of a bigger establishment but the friendliness of a smaller establishment. Our room faced the street and we still had no problems with noise. It wasn't particularly hot but the room got a bit stuffy at times so the a/c was nice. We had a problem with the a/c and also the TV remote stopped working and the front desk sent people to fix both problems pretty fast, so I would say the staff was very friendly and helpful. One nice touch was that when we checked out to leave at 6:30am, the man at the desk told us which way to go to walk to Catalunya to avoid the drunkards. As two women in our 20s, that was a nice little comforting touch that made our stay at the Apsis Splendid memorable and positive. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone, especially if you book early with the hotel directly on their website and get a good deal. It is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel. Will come again!”
Reviews.Author: Ralf-Sommer
Reviews.Content: We have been there for 4 nights: Very good location, Very clean, friendly and helpful stuff. Bit noisy with open window, but there´s an a/c. Brilliant breakfast (7 euro booked in advance).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kiwiabroad100
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Barcelona, we were not sure about condition of the hotel or its location, but judging by the mainly positive reviews we thought we would give it a shot. We were very impressed with every aspect of this hotel. Rooms were comfortable, but not big, but who spends time in their room anyway. Staff were friendly and spoke very good english, as our spanish was poor! We always felt safe and secure that our possesions would not be tampered with, safe was an extra charge at 3 euro per day. But most of all the location was perfect. A short stroll from Las Ramblas but still far enough away to ensure a good nights sleep. I will definitely stay at this hotel on my next trip to Barcelona. Hopefully that isn't too far away!

Reviews.Title: “Helen's 40th Birthday Gift”
Reviews.Author: JoeyCocoLoco
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day stay at the Aspis Spledid Hotel as a gift to my wife for her birthday. The location is "splendid" and you are totally safe . The hotel is small and functional and i would suggest that you take up the breakfast offer . There was no checking of how much breakfast you ate and i eat quite a big brekkie! The hotel was very clean and the staff very helpful. I would not hesitate to stay here again. Great and easy location. Watch where u eat at La Ramblas as some places rip u off for drinks ,,,,,,,,,,,eat at the Pizza / pasta restaurant at the top of La Ramblas .....4 bottles of wines , three courses about 140 euros (4 people) ..good value great food ......good service ......nice place . Lower down in la Ramblas , 4 large beers , two sangrias and four baguettes = 92 euros !!! Watch out for pickpockets but so long as u use your head , NO Problem !! However someone we met at the hotel was lifted 1 st day . Great place , great hotel , (so long as u are not looking for 4 star)

Reviews.Title: “Similar experience”
Reviews.Author: mikemo
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in early May prior to a Med cruise. Location, breakfast, price and staff all wonderful. View of many local apartment buildings. Airport Taxi was 24 Euro for 2 with 5 bags.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: oysterman
Reviews.Content: Booked 4 nights at the splendid. read the reviews from this site, so thought we would give it a go. First impressions were pleasing. The receptionist were very quick at booking us in. Hotel has a lift. The rooms even though quite small, was clean & decor not too bad. Every day towels exchanged & room cleaned. When we booked hotel you had choice of having b/fast @ half price. we did that, very nice as well, did not see the food police about. Eat as much as you could. We did the touristic bus for 2 days 23 euros each. Got to see all the sites. We also took the train to montserrat (spectacular) Last 2 days we used the metro, very quick & efficient. It takes a bit of time to get the right trains. Only minor hiccup was we got the bus from airport into city got off at universitat(splendid hotel 5 mins walk). On the way home we went to the place where it dropped us off not realising it does not pick up there & you have to go to Pl catalunya for it. If you like seafood we had a fantastic meal at El Barca Salamanca @ Port Olympic. They brought the food out to you before cooking it, you cannot get any fresher than that.. Overall a great time, weather was superb, our feet ache but well worth it

Reviews.Title: “'Splendid' location, but don't expect a room with a view!”
Reviews.Author: amacdonald22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Splendid for three nights early April and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The location is great, just five minutes walk from Las Ramblas with lots of bars, shops and restaurants nearby, The tour bus terminus is just around the corner, with tickets available from reception....a bargain at 24 euros for two days. We found the hotel very relaxing and informal. The staff friendly and helpful (not a breakfast policeman in sight!!). The food was fine, varied and plentiful, and the free pc with internet access came in useful. The room was fine, medium sized with well equipped bathroom and comfortable bed. The view was basically back yards and washing lines, just about what you would expect from a city centre hotel. The TV had CNN, several Spanish channels and one showing movies in English. It also had two further 'in house' channels showing films of an Adult nature, quite a shock when you're flicking through the stations early in the morning! Hardcore stuff, so parents with young kids be warned!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: lfm-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the apsis splendid for three nights and found the location excellent. Handy for tourist spots but not right in the thick of things so not too noisy. Hotel plus points. Location. Rooms basic but clean. Our room on the third floor was spacious. Breakfast excellent. Well worth booking in advance to get half price rate. Some of the food was not that hot (if its been out on the self service counter for a while) watch out for the fresh dishes being put out. Plenty of choice with fresh fruits, ham, cheeses, cereals and english breakfast staples. Negatives. No view at all from room. Windows looked out onto other facing windows. This made the room seem dark at all times. Not too much of a problem as we spent so little time in the room. Basically it was just somewhere to sleep. Bathroom toiletries were half empty when we arrived so had already been used by someone else. Didn't get replaced until our last night. So use sparingly! When checking in they don't tell you that you have to pay extra for room safe (3 euros a night) so you go all the way up to your room and then have to come down again to sort out. Would be better if they just told you at the start. The best bit about the hotel was the reception staff who could not have been more helpful. Joseph and Albert in particular. Nothing was too much trouble. They gave lots of helpful advice on where to go etc. From the aiport in taxi cost 27 euros for 4 people and 4 small cases (cases are extra) though our meter was already running when we got in it. Not sure if this is normal practice. We decide to brave the bus going back as by then we were more aware of our bearings. Bus goes from nearby square (5-10mins away) and costs 3.90 euros each. Buses run very regularly. We did the Barcelona open top bus tour (orange bus) which I was disappointed with. Commentary was by headphones which was a little boring. Noticed another bus company were doing live commentary which I would have preferred. Wished we had done that one. Fountains of Montjuic were worth seeing. Try to go at night to get a better effect as they use lights as well as music. La Ramblas very interesting at all times. Lots of live entertainment. Watch out for the naked man walking through the crowds wearing only a pair of tattooed trunks. Not for the faint hearted! Loved the food (fruit/meat/fish etc) market off La Ramblas, very colourful and plenty of choice. The prawns there are fantastic. Overall Barcelona is great. It has everything......the history, the marina, the beach, hundreds of bars and restaurants and PLENTY OF SHOPS!!!

Reviews.Title: “wrong information”
Reviews.Author: Glauber
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel they said us that there was heating in the rooms, for our suprise when we arrived at 8 pm, 13 degrees centigrades in the Barcelona, they told us that the city was "caliente" and it wouldn´t be necessary heating. We insisted, they said that they would turn it on, but the temperature continued too cold, we had to take shower and wearing cold clothes, and sleep in a cold bed. we don´t recomend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fweg
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Apsis Hotel in Barcelona for 5 nights at the beginning of March. We found the hotel a little difficult to find although this was probably our own fault, not figuring it out before hand and not being very good at reading a map! We got the bus from the airport which was easy and got off at the Universitat stop, it was cheap but if you are like us and get lost easily I would recommend geting a taxi, we did this on the way home and it was roughly €25, this was much easier. We were really pleased with the hotel, the Reception staff were friendly at all times, our room was very clean and cleaned every day during our stay. We didn't have a very good view from our room, just neighbouring walls but as we were out and about all the time this didn't matter. Once we got our bearings the hotel was very well situated, was about 10-15 mins walk from Las Ramblas and only 5 mins from the metro which was used for a few days. You can buy a ticket that you can use 10 times in one zone and we found it didn't expire after a day and ended up being able to use it for 3 days, which came in very handy when our feet were aching. I would recommened the bus tour as this is a great way to see the best sites in the city. We tried seeing the sites ourselves for a few days and didn't see as much as we did on our 1 day on the bus and gets pretty tiring doing it on foot! The bus does get quite busy but is definatly worth it. The evenings we mainly stayed around Las Ramlas area as this was close to our hotel and where we found plenty of restaurants. We did eat in one restaurant on Las Ramblas (its upstairs and looks posh) that we were quite disappointed with, we had to wait 20 mins for our table but as it looked so nice we didn't mind. We then waited a while for our food and when mine arrived it was cold and was very very small, my friend and I were left quite hungry! We then went for drinks and were pleased when we got some nibbles to go with them. Overall we had a really good city break, weather was sunny, hotel was lovely, good value for money and flights were a bargain at only £23 each!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey111
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a long weekend with my family at the Apsis Splendid and have high praise for this three-star hotel. Our rooms were very clean, as were all of the public areas. The staff at reception were extremely helpful and made us feel welcome. The buffet breakfast was excellent and plentiful, and included cooked (scrambled eggs, sausages and bacon), continental (ham and cheese), fresh fruit, rolls, croissants, muesli and much more. Staff refilled dishes continually and we felt free to eat as much as we wanted. The hotel is in a great location and we felt safe at all times. The Ramblas is within walking distance and the metro and bus stops are close by at Universitat and the Plaza Catalunya. My parents had a very nice room overlooking the street and were not troubled by the sound of traffic, as some reviewers have mentioned. I had a room that overlooked an inner courtyard - not much of a view and the room was quite dark, but it was quiet and very cosy. We spent so little time in the hotel and everything else was so good that it really didn't matter. As others have mentioned, the rooms are not that soundproof. We stayed from Thursday til Sunday and I was concerned that the hotel might be noisy over the weekend, but it was absolutely fine and we were not disturbed at all. I booked the rooms last November through Expedia and got a very good rate (80 euros per room for Thursday, and 90 euros for Friday and Saturday). If you book through the hotel's own website you can get a 50% reduction on the cost of breakfast (7 euros - good value). I would definitely stay at the Apsis Splendid again.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: F1ona
Reviews.Content: The location was ideal and the standards were above average for a 3 star hotel. However, there was one hiccup on arrival when we were told there was a problem with some of the rooms, there was no hot water, this would be fixed by later that evening. They had booked us into their neighbouring Apsis 40 Hotel that night and we could check into our room at the Apsis Splendid the following morning. They weren't prepared to compensate much, despite our attempts, all we got was free breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: expats
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and easy to walk to Las Ramblas, Gaudi buildings and the Gothic Quarter. We felt safe at all times. We opted for the breakfast and it was well worth it - huge spread of hot and cold items. We traveled with our infant and the hotel was very accommodating - upgraded us to a large room and set up a travel cot. The staff was helpful and gave us maps and good recommendations for eating. Our only complaint was that the rooms aren't completely soundproof and you can hear activity in other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Medium quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: rotrav
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with janemack; we stay in the same period and with the same problems, especially the "buffet police" issue. Very small room, just a few TV channels; for using the minisafe, is a fee of 3 euros/day - not so much, so I advise everyone to make this choice. After all, not so bad experience; the street (Cale de Muntaner) is a safe one, and just across the hotel is a small and friendly restaurant, not overpriced. In the morning, you can find a good choice of various coffes in Jamaica Cafe, which is at 5 minutes walking from hotel, near Universidad.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother if you're looking for a rest !”
Reviews.Author: janemack
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4night, 4 day trip to Barcelona, staying at the Apsis Splendid. We arrived late but were welcomed by the staff on duty who spoke very good English. Our room was very small ( 3rd floor ) and overlooked the washing lines, complete with washing for the residents of the area ! The bed was very hard and had a delightful rubber sheet on it so we were forced to lay a blanket over it for comfort. The bathroom was nicely done out but again very small. You had to stand at an angle to close the door behind you ! The deal we booked ( which was very good value ) with Go2Spain included breakfast every day. The breakfast area is very bright and spacious, the buffet is fantastic but is was guarded with what we termed the 'Breakfast Police' ! Every day, without fail, one of the staff stood guard over the food ! As soon as one left, another replaced them on guard !We found it incredibly uncomfortable so much so that the last day we didn't bother. There were signs up saying that food must not be taken out of the room - fat chance ! The Hotel was very noisy, lots of comings and goings throughout the night and early hours but the worst was yet to come - at 07.35 on the third morning, the WORK began - bang, bang, bang, drilling, electric saws coming from what we thought was the room next door - on further inspection it was on every floor ! There were dust sheets, paint, wooden flooring, furniture everywhere you looked ! We obviously complained at reception but they didn't have any rooms that weren't part of the Refurb ! We returned for a nap at 17.30 only to find them still hard at it ! Our request for a later start time was agreed - they manged to wait until 08.00 the last morning of our stay !! If still wanting to stay here, I suggest you wait until the work is finished - if you want any sleep. The plus side for us was the location, a safe, short walk to Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, could have been better.......”
Reviews.Author: SanFranExplorer
Reviews.Content: I checked out this hotel in my previous trip (stayed at another Apsis hotel) and thought I would definitely book this hotel when I come back to Barcelona. Well I did it this time and overall I must say I enjoyed the stay but with some minor issues. Generally speaking, the hotel is clean and tidy with contemporary furnishing and the marble bathrooms are simply beautiful, much like how the website describes. Best yet, the location and the price is unbeatable if you book it early from the website - 60~65 euro for a 3-star hotel double room per day. Can't beat it! However, this is not to say the hotel didn't have its problem. The third floor where I stayed at is in the midst of roof-repairing so the whole ceiling throughout the hallway was ripped out and construction started everyday early in the morning. The guestroom I was given is somewhat problematic - while the room is spacious, the wall is bit bang up and the carpet is not quite as clean. Also the noise from other guest rooms at 2:00am was really annoying...... Overall, I will still consider this hotel above average, I just wish I stayed at a different floor with a different room then my experience would have been greatly enhanced. Hopefully my next return to this hotel would be a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value if you reserve ahead.”
Reviews.Author: InMiami
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Splendid for 4 nights in mid-October. I made the reservation 9 months before our trip to get the best rates. I used their internet site which was easy to follow except for one issue; ordering their breakfast. If you opt for their breakfast buffet at time of reservation a half-price option is presented. At the time of our reservation that would have been 6 dollars each. I missed that screen which was unfortunate because it would have been a good deal. Our double room cost 89 Euros for a Wednesday and Thursday and 105 Euros for Friday and Saturday. As the date for our trip approached I continued to monitor the hotel internet site and the price eventually doubled! The tip here is to reserve as early as possible. The room was on the small side but nicely furnished and quite comfortable. Free Wi-Fi was available in the room as well as air-conditioning, small frig and cable TV with the all important English CNN. The modern, elegant bath room was done in wall-to-wall marble with double sinks and a glass enclosed shower/bath. Our room faced a small air shaft that was quiet but certainly had no view. The area is near Plaza Catalunia which is close to all the sights and in a relatively safe area. The university is one block away. All and all we liked the Splendid. The price was great for the quality of the hotel and the interior was clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “happy located tourist”
Reviews.Author: OKAussie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our needs - luxurious, clean, beautiful big bathroom, comfy beds - staff were nice & reasonably helpful - they did have their limits though. As proved by our lost luggage which they failed to follow up on our behalf. Plus they gave a card for a dodgy restaurant where you receive a free glass of wine but we never got our FREE glass. However, on complaining to Apsis about their recommendation they gave us a lovely free bottle of champagne. Not bad hey! Meanwhile, back to the hotel - easy location to walk or metro just about anywhere. There's a lift to your room, we took our own breakfast (they gave us some milk) so didn't try their food. Very happy with our choice, only wished we'd stayed longer. We booked over venere & this proved a good cheaper alternative too. Highly recommend Apsis Splendid!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid was... Splendid”
Reviews.Author: TooWheaty
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first European vacation (Western Mediterranean cruise) and stayed at the Apsis Splendid before and after. For the money (reasonable) this was a great hotel with very nice, clean rooms, beautiful bathrooms, free internet (shared station) and very friendly, helpful staff. We were quite happy that it was a 5 minute walk from the major hustle and bustle of La Rambla and Playa del Catalunya, but still very safe and accessible near the university. To anyone looking for comfort but still good value, and likes being a bit out of the centre of the craziness for their accommodation (but still walkable), Apsis Splendid was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Little hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: vipster187
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be a lovely place to stay while in Barcelona. It was a 10 minute walk from La Ramblas, which is far enough to remove all of the problems of staying right in the centre, and close enough to keep all the benefits such as shopping, eating, site seeing etc. the rooms are a little small but very clean and the bathrooms are immaculate. The staff are very nice and there is free internet access on the first floor. The common room is a great touch as we relaxed in there for part of last day as we checked out at 12pm and our flight was at 10pm. Overall, a great place to stay while in the city, fully recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Booker Beware!”
Reviews.Author: newexperiences
Reviews.Content: Be careful to ascertain exactly how much they charge when booking on the hotel's website. We booked for 6 days and we were supposed to get a 15% discount when staying for three or more days, We did not get it. My husband mentioned this when the time came to pay (taxi waiting for trip to airport) and they claimed they did not offer such a discount. Unfortunately, my husband signed the charge slip and off we went.. Upon advising Vsa and forwarding them their web ad listing this discount., they advised us since we signed the charge slip, we had to pay it. I am very sorry we did not use the American Express card as they are on the side of their member and not the purveyor. Lesson learned the hard way. $149.00 out of pocket. I would never stay at an Apsis again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: HT1
Reviews.Content: Spent one night on a quick stop in Barcelona. Had two rooms booked as there were four of us but the hotel had over booked and offered us a family room with three beds and two bathrooms. This was fine at and we saved the cost of one room. Location is great. Within walking distance to metro, la rambla etc. Bathrooms in hotel are on par with five star hotel. Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid, as the name suggests...”
Reviews.Author: Bunkle
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for four days in June of this year (2006) and found it to be a great base for exploring Barcelona. The hotel is very clean and comfortable and the staff are very helpful. Located just five minutes walk from the top of the Ramblas it is the perfect location to get around the city. The metro is only a minute away and the airport bus stopped at University Square which made it very easy to get in from the airport. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience Here”
Reviews.Author: SparrowHawk
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in the Splendid hotel June 7th and 8th and found the overall experience very good. We asked for a 3rd floor room which didn't face on to the street and slept very comfortably with little or no noise. Our rates where 110 for Wed nite 120 for Thr nite for a reasonable room size and biggest bathroom. The aircon was excellent and we had to leave it off the second night even though temps outside was 24C. Locationwise very good also , 2 mins to the University Metro which gets you every where. Buy a 10 tripper ticket for about 6.45Euro and you can used as a combination ticket ie 2 trips by just passing back to your mate/wife/friend etc.. = 5 trips X 2 people Overall staff nice also. You can walk to Ramblas in 5 mins also from Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: the_lowdown
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, central but on a relatively small street. Our room was on the 2nd floor facing an alley so it was very quiet. My husband and I were pleasantly surprised at how nice the room was for a 2-star. It looked newly renovated, including the bathroom. The bathroom had double sinks and even a biday. The room was large and included a sitting area, TV and safe. A great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid is Fab”
Reviews.Author: Madie99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely hotel in may with my boyfriend. We really enjoyed our stay there, it was clean, friendly and very central. Bedrooms are very nice with lovely bathrooms we had a back room on 2nd floor and found this room to be rather quiet. We didnt have breakfast in the hotel but "Starbucks" is not far from the Hotel if you love your coffee go there. Great way to see the city is to take the tour bus, you can hop on and hop off as much as you like and for a 2 day pass it is only 22 euro. Well worth it..... and go to the stadium even if your not a fan you will enjoy it like I did.... Lovely bar called cafe zurich is worth a look and cheap for drinks i.e 8 euro for 2 large drinks unlike la Rambla where 2 drinks even by day cost us 23 euro, dont get ripped off but la rambla is fab all the same.

Reviews.Title: “had a lovley time. perfect location”
Reviews.Author: vickimeds
Reviews.Content: I had no problems at all when staying at this hotel. The room was always clean and tidy and there was minimul noise from the street. we we on the 2nd floor. we had breakfast included and the food was lovely plenty of selction. The location was perfect. A block away was the metro stop and we fould a lovely bar which we visted every night. It was opposite the university. The Ramblas is a very short walk away and so it the contempery art museum. Had a fabulous time and we will be visting again as this is where my partner and i got engaged!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Fields of Athenry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights before Easter-chose hotel based on previous reviews on Trip Advisor, recommendation by Lonely Planet, and an excellent price (€75 per night without breakfast) for a central Barcelona hotel. Hotel is very convenient to Airport bus when arriving-bus (€3.75 each) stops at Gran Via-Universitat. From there walk back on Gran Via for 100 metres, turn left into Calle Muntaner and hotel is left hand side of street. Arrived before 12 noon but there was no problem checking in. Front desk was very friendly and helpful at all times and offered us a choice of a bright room in the front of the hotel or a dark quiet room in the rear. We took the quiet room knowing how noisy Spanish cities can be late at night and figuring that we wouldn't be spending many daylight hours in the room. The room was quiet,was clean and perfectly adequate. It was cleaned each day but we returned on the last day we were there at 4.30pm- after a long and warm day walking intending to get showered and changed before going to see La Font Magica in front of Palau Nacional (don't miss this)and then on for a meal-and the room hadn't been serviced. We went back out and returned at 6.30pm. and all was perfect-think this was purely a glitch given that the day (Good Friday) was a public holiday. We didn't have breakfast in hotel so can't comment on quality or price. There is coffee/hot water/teabags all day in the breakfast room and internet (slow) access on a computer outside the breakfast room. The hotel is conveniently located -the Universitat metro station is about 200 metres away, Placa de Catalunya and the Ramblas about 10 minutes walk, and La Barcelonetta is about a 30 minute walk. Returning to the Airport the best option is probably a taxi as the Airport bus departs from Placa de Catalunya outside El Corte Ingles-and the train also departs from there. It would be possible to take the metro from Universtad (lifts to platform) to Catalunya (lifts from platform to street level). Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, quiet location and good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 4 days in late September with our 16 month old son in a family room. The room was a great size for the 3 of us, spotlessly clean with a huge bathroom. Breakfast was excellent with a good choice. The location was ideal, being in a quite side street but only a short stroll from the Place Catelunya. The best thing of all was the staff who couldn't be more friendly or accomodating.
